description: Sum of numbers in trajectory of 3x+1 problem; first number n.
comments: Given a power of two, the value in this sequence is the next higher Mersenne number, or a(2^m) = 2^(m + 1) - 1. - _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 10 2009a(n) = sum (A070165(k): 1 <= k <= A006577(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 08 2011
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
example: a(5) = 36 because the Ulam's conjecture trajectory sequence starting on 5 runs 5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1 and therefore 5 + 16 + 8 + 4 + 2 + 1 = 36. - _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 10 2009
